greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Primes whose greatest digit is 1.
comment: Primes which are the sums of distinct powers of 10. - _Amarnath Murthy_, Nov 19 2002
These numbers are called Anti-Yarborough prime numbers in the Prime Pages Glossary (https://primes.utm.edu/glossary/page.php?sort=YarboroughPrime). - _Randy L. Ekl_, Jan 19 2019
link: Jon E. Schoenfield, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (first 1000 terms from T. D. Noe)
Index to entries for primes with digits in a given set
maple: N:= 10: # to get all entries with <= N digits
for d from 1 to N-1 do
S; # if using Maple 11 or earlier, uncomment the next line
program: (MAGMA) [p: p in PrimesUpTo(101111111) | Set(Intseq(p)) subset [0,1]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jul 27 2012
A020449_list = [n for n in (int(format(m,'b')) for m in range(1,2**10)) if isprime(n)] # _Chai Wah Wu_, Dec 17 2015
results.author: _David W. Wilson_
